title: Diabetic Retinopathy: Communication with the Physician Managing Ongoing Diabetes Care
description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of diabetic retinopathy who had a dilated macular or fundus exam performed with documented communication to the physician who manages the ongoing care of the patient with diabetes mellitus regarding the findings of the macular or fundus exam at least once within 12 months

attributes.value: None
attributes.name: Rate Aggregation

attributes.value: The physician that manages the on-going care of the patient with diabetes should be aware of the patient's dilated eye examination and severity of retinopathy to manage the on-going diabetes care. Such communication is important in assisting the physician to better manage the diabetes. Several studies have shown that better management of diabetes is directly related to lower rates of development of diabetic eye disease (Diabetes Control and Complications Trial  DCCT, UK Prospective Diabetes Study  UKPDS).
attributes.name: Rationale

attributes.value: While it is clearly the responsibility of the ophthalmologist to manage eye disease, it is also the ophthalmologist's responsibility to ensure that patients with diabetes are referred for appropriate management of their systemic condition. It is the realm of the patient's family physician, internist or endocrinologist to manage the systemic diabetes. The ophthalmologist should communicate with the attending physician (Level A: III Recommendation) (AAO, 2003).
attributes.name: Clinical Recommendation Statement

attributes.value: Higher score indicates better quality
attributes.name: Improvement Notation

These Measures are not clinical guidelines and do not establish a standard of medical care, and have not been tested for all potential applications. Commercial use is defined as the sale, license, or distribution of the Measures for commercial gain, or incorporation of the Measures into a product or service that is sold, licensed or distributed for commercial gain. Commercial uses of the Measures require a license agreement between the user and the AMA, (on behalf of the PCPI) or NCQA. Neither the AMA, NCQA, PCPI nor its members shall be responsible for any use of the Measures.

The AMA, NCQA, the PCPI and its members disclaim all liability for use or accuracy of any Current Procedural Terminology (CPT[R]) or other coding contained in the specifications.

attributes.name: Disclaimer

attributes.value: American Academy of Ophthalmology. Preferred Practice Patterns Committee. Diabetic Retinopathy. 2003.
attributes.name: Reference

attributes.value:
Communication  May include documentation in the medical record indicating that the findings of the dilated macular or fundus exam were communicated (e.g., verbally, by letter) with the clinician managing the patients diabetic care OR a copy of a letter in the medical record to the clinician managing the patients diabetic care outlining the findings of the dilated macular or fundus exam.

Findings-includes level of severity of retinopathy AND the presence or absence of macular edema.
attributes.name: Definition

attributes.value: None
attributes.name: Guidance

attributes.value: TBD
attributes.name: Transmission Format

attributes.value: All patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of diabetic retinopathy
attributes.name: Initial Patient Population

attributes.value: Equals Initial Patient Population who had a dilated macular or fundus exam performed
attributes.name: Denominator

attributes.value: None
attributes.name: Denominator Exclusions

attributes.value: Patients with documentation, at least once within 12 months, of the findings of the dilated macular or fundus exam via communication to the physician who manages the patients diabetic care
attributes.name: Numerator

attributes.value: Not Applicable
attributes.name: Numerator Exclusions

attributes.value:
Documentation of medical reason(s) for not communicating the findings of the dilated macular or fundus exam to the physician who manages the ongoing care of the patient with diabetes

Documentation of patient reason(s) for not communicating the findings of the dilated macular or fundus exam to the physician who manages the on-going care of the patient with diabetes
attributes.name: Denominator Exceptions

attributes.value: Not Applicable
attributes.name: Measure Population
